history.content:
I say take CS70 with Data 8, and have a somewhat difficult semester (cause cs70), but also have time to yourself. Data 8 is interesting, though some coding intro might be repetitive, the stats and simulation and data science components I think you will like. Definitely try to preview some material before 70 so its not as much of a shock when the workload starts HIGH at the beginning of the semester. 

Maybe take a cool decal, join a club,  sign up to be an AI, etc. 

I would recommend maybe something like CS 170 and CS 61C in the next semester!

——————————————————-
Second perspective from someone who completed CS70+ Data8 in the same semester. I agree with the perspective above. Data8 is a good Combo of coding and stats. CS70 is a heavy theory class which is important for many upper division class. Interestingly, 1 or 2 of the topics in 70 are mentioned in Data8 (of course at a very basic level) like Law of Large Numbers and chebyshev’s inequality and the way it’s explained in Data8 actually helped intuitively understand the same concepts in 70 behind the heavy math and formulae. Pretty cool I thought but In short as the above person said, I second their opinion In that you should take 70+Data8. Hope this helps!

I say take CS70 with Data 8, and have a somewhat difficult semester (cause cs70), but also have time to yourself. Data 8 is interesting, though some coding intro might be repetitive, the stats and simulation and data science components I think you will like. Definitely try to preview some material before 70 so its not as much of a shock when the workload starts HIGH at the beginning of the semester. 

Maybe take a cool decal, join a club,  sign up to be an AI, etc. 

I would recommend maybe something like CS 170 and CS 61C in the next semester!

Hi, I'm a second year student trying to plan my schedule for the spring. I'm aiming to declare L&S cs, and so far I've taken 61A and 61B. I got solid A's in both but I definitely struggled with the workload/lack of resources in 61B. I only need a C in 70 to declare but I try to aim for A's, and would like at least a B+ in all my technicals. I don't have any stats background. I'm pretty good at math but the highest level math I've done is only 1b.

Can anyone recommend whether I should take Data 8 or 61C alongside 70? I'm currently enrolled in Data 8 as I thought it would be an easier tech to pair with 70 and I don't have any data science experience and thought it would be cool to try it out, but since I'm in a good position to declare I'm now thinking it could be good to get 61C out of the way since I haven't done many classes yet for the major. I love Dan Garcia though and he isn't teaching this semester, and I like to have free time aside from classes so I'm not sure if this is a good combo. Would really appreciate any advice, thank you!
history.subject: L&S CS Spring Sophomore schedule
